intro: Alsophila isaloensis, commonly known as the Isalo tree fern, is a species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Its fronds can reach lengths of up to 3 meters, contributing to its ornamental value. Alsophila isaloensis plays a significant ecological role in its native habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
